intro: Lepidium granulare, commonly known as the granular cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and features small, white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and slightly hairy, while its fruits are small, dry pods containing several seeds. Lepidium granulare is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
